title: Optimal Pre-Training Strategies in Computer-Based Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Social Science Theories and Experience with Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: A social sector job competency enhancement course for working professionals, including experimental designs to validate video-based instructional learning and pre-training effects, with personalized learning support through analysis of individual cognitive load levels and learning motivation

learning_goals: Learners can quantify changes in cognitive load based on the presence or absence of pre-training in computer-based environments.
Learners can utilize assessment tools to distinguish between intrinsic, extraneous, and germane cognitive loads occurring during video-based instructional learning.
Learners can demonstrate the impact of topic interest and achievement motivation on learning outcomes through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
